title: Lord Krishna in Sound Form: Chant with Reverence | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | Gaura Mandala Parikrama

We are going to think. So, because we see, we are hearing sounds, so many sounds we are hearing. So we hear this sound also like that.

segments.key_quote: Chaitanya Charitamrita reveals that Krishna Naama is a Surya of Satchitananda... Existence, knowledge and bliss. It's an infinite source. Because that is Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna's name is the sun of eternity, knowledge and bliss, which is the natural atmosphere for the soul.
segments.transcript: Hare Krishna Mahamantra. Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, Chaitanya Charitamrita reveals that Krishna Naama is a Surya of Satchitananda. Surya of Satchitananda means son of Satchitananda. What is normal son? It's a son of light and heat. Now we are talking about son of Satchitananda. Light and heat is energy. So son of Satchitananda means Sat, Chit and Ananda energy. Existence, knowledge and bliss. It's an infinite source. Because that is Krishna. Krishna is Satchitananda Vigraha, Anadhi Radhi Govinda, Sarva Karna Karna. So Krishna Naama is a Surya of Satchitananda. Krishna is Surya of Satchitananda. Krishna Naama is also Surya of Satchitananda. All that our soul seeks in this world or in the spiritual world is to be immersed in this Sat, Chit and Ananda Shakti. That is our natural atmosphere. Whereas now the soul is in the atmosphere of Asat Shakti, Achit Shakti and Nirananda Shakti. This is Maya energy. There is internal energy, spiritual energy of the Lord. Satchitananda energy. Sat means eternity. We all want eternal life. We all want eternal relationship. We all want eternal love. There is no doubt about it. But in the bodily life we never get any of these things. So soul's nature is to seek Sat. Chit, pure knowledge, pure understanding, not ignorance. And Ananda means bliss, love, loving exchanges, exchanges of loving, exchanges of pleasure. These are all very natural for the soul.

segments.key_quote: So soul is always incomplete in this material world. Therefore it is eternally it is hungry. Never satisfied... Just like our soul is like the piece of iron. We have to put in the fire of Satchitananda.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the soul is eternally hungry in the material world and uses the analogy of iron in fire to explain how chanting affects us.
segments.transcript: But somehow or the other even though very natural for us in this material world we are always defeated in our efforts for Satchitananda. So soul is always incomplete in this material world. Therefore it is eternally it is hungry. Never satisfied. So Krishna Nama is Surya of Satchitananda. The Surya of Satchitananda. And now Prabhupada explains how this works. When you put a piece of iron in the fire, the heat moves from the fire to the piece of iron. And gradually the piece of iron gets heated little by little. The longer it stays it gets heated and becomes red hot. The iron gets the quality of fire. At least 5 to 6 times Prabhupada has explained this phenomenon of how chanting works. So it is very important for us to remember this analogy of Prabhupada. Because from this analogy many things we understand about the phenomena of how actually Hare Krishna chanting influences us,
